content: a guide for average sizes of head once you have achieved your desired hat length work either a rolled or a ribbed brim rolled brim change to the smaller needle and continue knitting for 2 cm / ¾ for children s sizes or 2 5 cm / 1 for teen/adult sizes cast off using a stretchy cast off method such as the russian or icelandic cast off the stocking stitch / stockinette brim will roll up ribbed brim change to the smaller needle and work k2/p2 rib for 7 cm / 2 ¾ cast off use a firm but stretchy cast off i recommend either the russian or icelandic cast off methods finishing weave in all yarn ends for best results the beanie should be wet blocked soak it in lukewarm water with the addition of a no-rinse soap such as eucalan or soak for at least 20 minutes to allow the stitches to relax then squeeze it very gently and roll in a clean towel to remove excess water gently stretch over a partly-inflated balloon and then continue to inflate it to the correct circumference for the hat you have made allow to air dry if you have made the i-cord crown beanie knot the i-cord firmly at its base so that the knot sits against the hat crown ideas for adapting this pattern when working multiple stripes of different scraps of yarn work 2 or 3 rounds of alternating colours at the beginning of each changeover in a checkerboard pattern to give the stripes a unique appearance this variation was used in the purple striped hat see chart at right for an example colour block work the i-cord knot and ribbing in one colour and the hat body in another work alternating single rounds of lots of different yarns or of two contrasting or complementary colours or a plain and a patterned yarn your finished hat will be unique vary the style of ribbing i used k2/p2 ribbing for a simple finish but garter rib looks great and k1/p1 would give a tighter brim if you want to use a three-stitch rib such as k2/p1 or p2/k1 you may need to decrease your stitch count before beginning the ribbing for instance decrease 0 1 2 2 1 2 sts evenly around the hat resulting in a stitch count of 120 135 150 174 183 198 sts work your desired 3-stitch rib acknowledgements grateful thanks go to
